header.subtitle: Web Dev
lang.label: EN
bio.summary.title: Summary
bio.summary.text: Software Engineer with experience in full-stack development (React, TypeScript, Next.js/Node.js), REST APIs, and relational databases. Proven ability to understand complex codebases and perform testing to ensure system reliability. Brings a strong technical foundation in software design principles via a Bachelor of Business Information Systems from a leading German university (TU Darmstadt), and is comfortable working in a Linux dev environment.
bio.skills.title: Skills
bio.education.title: Education
bio.education.degree: Bachelor, Business Information Systems | TU Darmstadt
bio.education.period: Oct 2018 – Feb 2024 | Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany
bio.education.thesisLink: Visualization of Branch and Bound Algorithms for the Traveling Salesman Problem
bio.experience.title: Professional Experience
bio.experience.freelance.title: Freelance Web Developer
bio.experience.freelance.item1: Managed end-to-end delivery of web projects, from requirement gathering to final deployment.
bio.experience.freelance.item2: Translated technical constraints into clear, accessible language for non-technical stakeholders to manage expectations and define project scope.
bio.experience.freelance.item3: Applied best-practice web accessibility standards to ensure inclusive design.
bio.experience.econsor.title: Frontend Developer | ECONSOR
bio.experience.econsor.item1: Translated functional requirements into clean, maintainable code, ensuring adherence to strict quality standards (WCAG 2.1 AA).
bio.experience.econsor.item2: Collaborated in an Agile environment to deliver high-quality software features within sprint timelines.
bio.experience.fraunhofer.title: Part-time Software Developer | Fraunhofer Institute for Secure Information Technology (SIT)
bio.experience.fraunhofer.item1: Contributed to a complex, commercial Java backend for an application vulnerability scanner.
bio.experience.fraunhofer.item2: Developed targeted Android applications to perform unit and integration tests on scanner components, ensuring code quality and reliability.
bio.experience.tudarmstadt.title: Part-time Web Developer | TU Darmstadt
bio.experience.tudarmstadt.item1: Set up and managed WordPress-based websites, including programming individual custom JS/HTML/CSS elements.
bio.projects.title: Key Projects
bio.projects.recipes.title: gettinger-recipes.com
bio.projects.recipes.subtitle: Website
bio.projects.recipes.item1: Engineered a full-stack web application using React and Next.js.
bio.projects.recipes.item2: Integrated a third-party system: built a chatbot using the Claude REST API and custom system prompts to allow users to adapt recipes to their needs.
bio.projects.recipes.item3: Implemented user authentication (NextAuth.js) and a Postgres database.
bio.projects.po.title: Product Owner | TU Darmstadt, Group Project
bio.projects.po.item1: Led a team of students to create a mobile app, creating and maintaining a product backlog based on client specifications in Jira.
bio.projects.po.item2: Facilitated communication between the client and development team.
projects.portfolio.title: Personal Portfolio
projects.portfolio.tagline: The site you're looking at right now
projects.portfolio.description: A personal portfolio site featuring a WebAssembly-powered pointillist background animation. Built with Next.js and AssemblyScript, with dynamic color theming extracted from cycling background photos and full English/German localization.
projects.recipes.title: Gettinger Recipes
projects.recipes.description: A recipe web application with an AI-powered chatbot that helps users adapt recipes to their needs. Features user authentication, a Postgres database, and integration with the Claude API for intelligent recipe suggestions.
projects.recipes.tech: React, Next.js, NextAuth.js, Postgres, Claude API
projects.seebnb.title: SeeBnB
projects.seebnb.tagline: Branch and Bound visualization for the Traveling Salesman Problem
projects.seebnb.description: An interactive educational tool that visualizes how the branch and bound algorithm solves the Traveling Salesman Problem. Users can customize initial solution methods, search strategies, and bounding strategies, with real-time map and graph visualizations. Built as a bachelor's thesis project at TU Darmstadt.
projects.seebnb.tech: React, Gatsby, D3, Mapbox, Deck.gl, Web Workers
projects.khalid.title: Khalid McGhee
projects.khalid.description: A professional website designed and developed for a freelance client. Built with a focus on clean design, accessibility, and responsive layout.
playground.title: Pointillist Playground
playground.description: Upload your own image or choose one below, then adjust the settings to create your own pointillist artwork.
